Understate: The claim may understate the impact of inflation on household income by not taking into account rising prices over time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully justify the assertion that Americans haven't had a raise in 15 years, as it only presents data up until January 2014.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the drop in median household income, such as changes in the composition of households or shifts in the job market.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there has been a 2 percent increase in median usual weekly earnings for full-time workers over the age of 16.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the situation by not considering the increase in earnings for full-time workers and focusing solely on median household income.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a comprehensive analysis of all factors influencing income growth or decline.
